review_text: What an amazing stay at the Bighorn Lodge. Itâ€™s centrally located not far from Denver so the drive was easy and communication was great. Its private surroundings, patio and security combined with Mountain Viewâ€™s; majestic. All the photos definitely speak true to the rustic Lodge feel and it is beautifully maintained with an enormous gas fireplace that kept me toasty while I visited. There arenâ€™t any curtains covering the southwest views so sunrise and sunsets are gorgeous as well as seeing the weather rolling through. We had a bit of a snowstorm on my second night come through, which was amazing to watch. my only critique is, the windows were pretty dusty and spotty, so Photography through them was challenging with lots of glare, but I donâ€™t think that something that can be rectified as the windows face the gorge side and Iâ€™m sure are very difficult to clean outside of the weather doing its job. Other than that, lots of amenities everything is fully stocked. Loved every minute. Thanks!

name: Melissa

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We traveled to The Royal Gorge from Texas. The first day / night we were gifted the most incredible views of the Gorge from the absolutely stunning cabin. We were warned about an incoming snowstorm upon arrival and decided to stick it out & make the best of it. We ended up losing power and the pipes froze overnight. The park Ranger was prompt in snowplowing his way to us first thing in the morning to check on us to make sure we were ok. He said he understand if we wanted to leave but it was just too beautiful for us to even think of it. He came back without us asking to bring water & help us get the fireplace going. He continually plowed our roads throughout the day so we could get out if need be. I cannot say enough about the amazing hospitality & friendliness of the staff at the park. This couldâ€™ve easily been a fiasco of a vacation but the amazing cabin, the views and the staff made it one of the best places we have ever stayed. We canâ€™t wait to come back with better weather! :)

review_text: This is a must visit. The views are priceless, the hikes were invigorating, the bridge was amazing to walk in the daytime and to see lit up at night from the dwelling. The Park Rangers and staff were so accommodating, helpful and friendly. I truly appreciated the pricing being affordable for so many to experience not just the elite. Canon City was a short drive to be able to dine and explore. The railroad train tracks you could view if you looked straight down from the cabin/dwelling windows train boarded in Canon City and known as the Royal Gorge Route Railroad. This was a pleasant experience as well, but not cheap for the 2 hour ride, they did have different price levels to choose. I can not thank the Royal Gorge Park team enough for this experience to share with my family and future son-in-law. The memories of this visit will always be ones I will cherish. Thank you from Boonville, Missouri

The price has gone up considerable, but I guess that's expected with inflation over the past few years. We hosted Thanksgiving dinner at the place and there was plenty of cookware and room to do so. Our only suggestion is that the table is a bit small! We had the same thought years ago. With the amount of room supplied, they could buy a real showstopping table that allows more of a view during dinner. Wonderful accommodations!

review_text: Loved the mid century modern style with the huge great room, massive fireplace and floor to ceiling windows. The view and location canâ€™t be beat. We loved having a house in the middle of our week of vacation to do laundry and save some money by making our own meals. We used the grill which was nice and new. Speaking of saving money, a huge perk is the fact that everyone staying at the house gets free admission to the park for every day of their stay â€” including check in and check out day.

name: Hayden
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: The Royal Gorge Park owns this lodge, so we dealt w/ park staff during our stay. After check-in we received a key to the Bighorn Lodge and a remote to the park gate for after hours exit/entry. All the staff were great and easy to deal with. The lodge is walking distance from the visitors center (main entry to the park & attractions), but it is a consistent uphill walk back to the lodge. It's a 2 minute or less drive. The views are amazing. There a lots of birds, lizards, and bighorn sheep that frequent the area. You can see the skycoaster, gondola, zipliners, and even the train and folks rafting on the river below. With binoculars you can watch people climbing the Via Ferrata. The air conditioner was working very well the whole time, but the south facing rooms still get a bit warm in the evening (in August). There are lots of fans, so we managed well. Overall, the value for this place was amazing. If you want to chill or if you want a lot of activity, this place has what you want.

review_text: Loved this house! Itâ€™s a phenomenal location and the views were amazing, even impressing my 17 and 21 year old sons, which is rare. The complimentary park tickets and ease of proximity allowed us to enjoy the Royal Gorge Bridge and activities everyday. Plenty of hiking and wildlife (bighorn, rabbits, and birds) literally in the back yard. The large patio allowed us to play our own games (we brought ladder ball) but board games were also provided in the house. I cooked meals everyday using the provided kitchen supplies and outdoor gas grill. Tons of seating, inside and out. Lots of activities in the area. We participated in: helicopter tour, white water rafting, train ride, and bowling. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend!

This was fine for our kids sharing a bed but not for 2 adults. I think the listing should be updated to accurately state that these are not Queen beds. review_text:
Awesome place to stay! The lodge is walking distance to the park entrance, but still feels secluded. The windows overlook the gorge and the windows opened to get a nice breeze through the house. This was really needed the first evening, as it was quite warm inside. The view was the best part, once we got over our fear to look out the windows down into the gorge. We really enjoyed watching the zip liners & gondolas crossing the gorge, & the rafters fighting the rapids down in the river. The place was really spacious for our family of 4. Free tickets to the park were just icing on the cake. This is definitely one not to miss!
You may not want to keep the windows opened unattended. My teen was eating her leftovers near the opened windows the last day of our stay and almost had a mouse in her lap. It ran in the window and almost hopped in her lap to try get a bite of her dinner. We closed them, after her screams scared it out. It did make me nervous about what else mightâ€™ve gotten in.

Group trip
review_text: For several years, my hiking group has booked a stay at the Royal Gorge Bighorn Lodge. Although the Lodge has changed into an Airbnb, Gail still takes care of the bookings, communicates well, & if you are in need of something special, will arrange it for you if she can. Currently, renovations are being made to the building, but this doesn't interfere with your stay. New electrical outlets have been added in the room with the large exquisite picture windows. Beds are very comfortable, & extra blankets, sheets, etc. are available in the room with carpet. The kitchen is nicely equipped, though know that the oven takes quite a while to preheat :) The carpeted bedroom is a little colder at night than the rest, but has an amazing amount of space as well as a small built-in desk. The large fireplace is magnificent, easy to light, and adds to the ambiance of the Lodge. We will continue to book this magnificent place every year, for as long as we are able! Thanks for a fabulous stay!

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I don't really know what to say about this place but WOW. There are those Air BnB's that no matter how impressive the photos, they just do not do it justice. Wait until you walk in and get the parallax vertigo that is walking to the huge windows overlooking the gorge. Like no place I've ever stayed. You should know it's an older cabin so if you're an Air BnB snob it may not be for you. But what else would you want on the rim of a canyon such as this? Also know you will be totally isolated (except for a ranger on duty during the evening) after the park closes and you will be the ONLY people in the area after dark. So if you have some sort of The Shining fear go in knowing. We were not able to get fast WIFI, nor consistent connect speeds so working from here is a bit difficult. But Gail was very helpful in trying to get it resolved. It just didn't work out for us. But it was the excuse we needed to disconnect anyway. We LOVED it. Truly one of the most unique places I've stayed in all my Air BnB travels.
We didn't know much about Royal Gorge and it quickly became of of our favorite stops in Colorado. I highly recommend for the more hard core adventurers trying the Via Verrata course. Life-changing. For me, facing my fear of cliff-climbing. If you're already a hard core free climber it might seem pedestrian I imagine. In Canon City we really enjoyed the Mexican at El Caporal. Hike the Canyon Rim Trail to Far Out to Le View. Just do it. Also do not miss the opportunity to set your alarm for sunrise and go out on the deck and watch the rising sun paint the canyon walls in brilliant colors.
Thank you, Gail, for sharing such an amazing place, in such an amazing location.

Beyond the incredible view, we loved the following: this house is very well maintained, the kitchen was perfect for cooking family meals, the bathrooms are in great shape, the house is well stocked with everything you could need, the living and sleeping spaces are comfortable, the outdoor patio is sizable and a great spot for stargazing, the house and Royal Gorge park are dog friendly, and check-in and out were beyond easy.
Finally, we had a toddler and 6 month old with us and this location could not have been better! It made it so easy to visit the Royal Gorge Park multiple times in a day and come home for naps.

My recommendations if you plan to stay here: bring groceries (the gas grill and fully equipped kitchen make cooking easy), visit Canon City (itâ€™s a short drive), reserve a ride in advance (maybe lunch or dinner) on the train that goes through the gorge, raft or kayak the Arkansas river, and drive the Skyline Drive (scary but amazing!)

This house was truly incredible! Three girlfriends and I stayed for 3 nights/4 days and we can not say enough great things about this home!
1. The VIEWS! ğŸ˜ I have never been so content, sitting without distraction and staring out a window as I did at this house.
2. The FIRE! ğŸ”¥ this fireplace is a thing of dreams. Itâ€™s huge and mesmerizing, and so cozy.
3. The access to the park! This was a HUGE added bonus. And every single person we spoke to at the park (rangers, the technicians working the gondola, the bartender at the cafe, the gift shop attendee, and the person at the ticket desk) were all SO kind.
4. The beds! Very comfortable mattresses, and the bedding was so soft and clean.
5. The kitchen had everything we needed for all of our cooking, and the bathrooms were updated and super clean!
Also, as silly as it is - we felt like VIPs having our own gate opener to the park, an exclusive experience for sure!
We have already discussed when we will be returning. 100% would recommend!!

name: Colette
rating_info:

,
Â·
January 2022
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: Our 2 night/3 day stay at the Bighorn Lodge was superb! They have redecorated, and although we preferred the more rustic furniture (our 4th stay at the Lodge) the new beds and couches were extremely comfortable - we were all well rested and took advantage of hiking a new trail on a bright sunny day after a recent snow. Gorgeous! Upon our return to the Lodge, we made some delicious meals, as the kitchen was well stocked with cooking supplies, full range/oven, large refrigerator with ice maker, lots of counter space, and many electrical outlets. With all the picture windows, we enjoyed spectacular sunrises & sunsets. The large gas fireplace in the living room just turns on/off with a switch! During the winter months, If you park in the lot right behind the lodge the downhill walk to the Lodge can be a little icy - just tread carefully. Also, if you leave at night, bring a flashlight so you can see your way up to the car. There is an outside light but not in the parking area itself. Check-in and check out is easy and fast; also if offered, take advantage of getting into the Park and walking the Bridge and/or riding the Gondolas for free! We were able to walk across the Bridge & explore the park, even though the Gondolas were not operating that day. It was a fabulous trip and we hope to do it again at least once a year, and for many years to come!

name: Tracy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We stayed here for a trip to canon city to visit the railroad and the royal gorge bridge park. This place is in a great location in canon city, close to supermarkets, parks, the railroad and the highway to drive out to the gorge. We really appreciated the kids blocks and books in the space for our son to play with. Our son, who is 3.5 years, slept in the hideaway bed and he loved it. The air-conditioning was a welcome respite from the scorching heat the area was experiencing at the time. The kitchen was well stocked for cooking and really had everything you need to make meals while staying there. You can tell that the owners have a real eye for design and detail. It would have been nice to be able to use the outside area even just a little, as our toddler can get restless inside, but I understand their hesitation since they also live on the property. We found a playground about 5 minutes away that helped when he got restless. If we are in the area again in the future, we would feel good about staying here again.

The cottage is very nice and clean, cozy and has a great floor plan. The outside covered patio is quite nice to relax under. Loved having a wahser and dryer there. All amenities were provided both kitchen and bath. One thing I would suggest is turning up the hot water temp on the hot water heater, or updating for hotter wate durring showers.
This is a cool spot with great vibes and access for climbers. Would stay again.

review_text:
This is such a cute house! Cozy, retro feel and decor. I would not have more than 2 people in this house. The kitchen had a lot of things I needed including salt, pepper, some pots to cook with, coffee, even small individual containers of half and half with to go cups and lids. There were some condiments in the fridge.
Many of the properties in Canon City are older and the house did not feel well insulated. I could feel air leaking in around the doors and windows. Normally this would not be a concern but my husband and I stayed here when it was SUPER cold outside, like below 0. We woke up the first morning and felt like we were in an igloo! We had the heaters on 88 degrees but it was frigid outside, and probably due to lack of insulation, the heaters could not keep up. I messaged the host and a woman who helps host the house and lives down the street was there in 20 minutes. She brought a rockinâ€™ space heater and checked on my husband later in the day. Way to go Brooke! Weâ€™ll be back

Kevin is proud of this place and he should be because it is STUNNING. The only downsides were personal preference issues. We prefer contactless check-in and a bit more privacy. The exterior cam at the hot tub made it a little awkward, but understand that hosts have this option at their discretion. We also didn't prefer to have the host outside sweeping the sidewalk while we were packing up (before check-out time), but, overall, I've really never seen a more thoughtfully decorated home and the place was lovely.

It's a short walk to downtown Canon City, with shops and restaurants.
Rich, met us at check-in and was warm and helpful (even though we arrived early and interrupted his run), ensuring our comfort and provided outstanding local recommendations (the Indian restaurant was excellent). The Airbnb was very clean, comfortable, and well-appointed, featuring inviting living spaces and bedrooms. I felt like I could move to Canon City and happily live in this home.
In summary, this welcoming retreat near historic downtown Canon City, combined with Rich's hospitality and Kevin's clear communication, made for an unforgettable stay. Ideal for families or couples, don't hesitate to book this charming hideaway for a memorable experience.

There was plenty of room for our family of 5, a huge kitchen with everything you could want, a washer and dryer, games in the game cabinet and a specific cornhole area outside. The rest of the backyard was fabulous with so much seating, a hot tub and very nice landscaping. Everything locks up easily with a code and there is a carport out back. We were sad to leave. It felt like home away from home. The only recommendation I would make is for the host to make sure it is finished being cleaned when guests arrive. We waited for a short time on the front porch because they were still cleaning when we got there. We stated we would arrive between 4-5 and got there at 3:50, but did wait about 30 minutes get in. Other than that, I would highly recommend this place! I would definitely go back. Kevin is a great and very attentive host. I appreciated it!

review_text: We booked Kevin's home for a "Moms Weekend Away" to go antiquing in nearby Florence and be somewhere a short distance from Colorado Springs. This home was breathtaking and more than we could ever have imagined. Every detail was thoughtful. We loved relaxing in the hot tub, having a large table to eat together and for evening games, and a huge kitchen to prep our snacks and meals. We had an issue at check-in but Kevin was very helpful and quick to respond. We were a few blocks from the main street in Canon City and a short 15 minute drive to adorable Florence. I would absolutely recommend this home and hope to return again!

Kevin has thought of everything little thing. Any kitchen gadget you need is there. Even a wok and dishes for a Chinese dinner. Want to serve a roast? Kitchen is all set for that! Bake some cookies or blend a daiquiri, it's there. And darn near every utensil you could need! I promise you will love this home!

So after being out all day we would come home to a warm and lit house. We will definitely be coming back the next time we visit Colorado!

review_text:
Theyâ€™ve thought of everything! This house was just perfect for our group. The inside of the house is so well decorated and Kevin cut no corners in remodeling it. We were all very impressed by the decor, the the furnishings, and the quality of the amenities. All the small things from the toiletries being stocked to the actual Teflon pans in the kitchen to cook with, to the Keurig and bar, they seemed to ensure everything had been thought of and covered. Only one note of clarification from the description, a crib is not included. It is actually a pack n play, which may make a difference to parents with climbers, since those are much easier to get out of for 1-2 year olds.
Outside of everyone wanting to go home and remodel their own kitchens because they were so in love with the design of this house, we had no complaints at all!
Walking distance to a park, the river and pond to feed ducks, we also were able to walk to downtown for lunch and to poke around the shops. Loved the house and appreciated the host!

review_text: Hello, the visit to Canon City was fun and the house is nice. Upon arrival we met with Liz and she did a tour of the home. Everything was amazing but will make some suggestions. The outside needs to be wiped down or even hosed down as there are many spider webs on the house and on the outdoor lights and by the hot tub. I did attempt to clean it up but stopped as it's not my job to do. Did run into a very creepy spider but made sure to keep our distance. We did miss a communication with one another about the outdoor grill but we figured it out. A response was provided but that was after the fact. No biggie and thanks. I really recommend to stay here as you will enjoy. Thanks again Liz and Kevin and we look forward to making another reservation at your home again.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Such a gorgeous A-frame cabin! Perfect peaceful getaway in the mid of mountains. A very cozy setup that's well appointed and organized as well. Kara, the owner, reached out and ensured that we had everything we needed. The cabin is also well supplied with dry non perishables, pots and pans, cutlery, spices and a lot of hot chocolate, perfect for the winter! Surrounded by aspens and evergreens I imagine the place would be gorgeous in all seasons. The bird feeders around bring a whole lot of jays and chickadees and other birds, fun to watch too! Curling up with a book, going for a little walk on the property, watching the birds, a bit of board games in between and a beautiful warm fireplace. Couldn't ask for more! Would love to return in another season and experience it all over again!

name: St George
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I've stayed at many airbnbs around the globe and the Muddy Moose was by far the best provisioned. Every cabinet door revealed more practical and useful items that made our stay simple and relaxing. Each day we returned from a demanding hike we found all that we needed quickly and it made our stay simply enjoyable. Initially concerned that the location was a bit remote and removed from activities; we found that anything we desired was within an hours drive and came to love the central hub the Muddy Moose provided. We hit hot springs twice, climbed Mt. Yale and caught beautiful trout. Kara was attentive and available without being intrusive. Hole in the wall Hartsel provided surprisingly delicious pizzas and Miss Amy and her staff were the highlight of the trip. My brother and I agreed that Amy's sweet treats were well worth the drive from Tennessee. All in all a 10/10 experience.

The indoor fire made this so much fun while we made sâ€™mores and played games after a day in Breckinridge or Colorado Springs.
The beds were very uncomfortable and hard, making our 6 day long stay very rough. While this is okay for short 1-2 day stays, anything longer makes this worth mentioning.
Overall our stay was great! It was definitely a memorable stay. Thanks, Muddy Moose!

I used to live in Canon City, and it's close to downtown--which has walkable options for food and browsing local businesses.

But it was all the little details that made it an over-the-top experience. From the mini-bar (didnâ€™t partake, but was completely unexpected) to the fully stocked kitchen, including spices and an expresso machine, to the board games, and every possible little thing you may need in a mountain cabin (including emergency oxygen - which for us flat landers was quite the novelty).
Stephanie was so detailed in her instructions and gave great suggestions for local restaurants and things to do in the area.
If you are looking for a secluded mountain cabin with exceptional scenery, that has all the comforts of home and then some, IDLEWILD is the place for you.
Thank you Stephanie!

review_text: Stephanie is a very gracious and attentive host. Her cabin is nestled into beautiful surroundings and is a fantastic cabin. She has thoughtfully decorated each room and the cabin is engineered for peaceful relaxation. The windows in the main level living room allow for a front row view outside at all times. We saw a family of deer, an elk, a jack rabbit and enjoyed constant chipmunk and bird activity. Stephanie is very responsive to your messages and more than happy to provide information to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. She provided information on great spots to fish and it's the first time I have ever heard my husband say he was worn out from catching so many fish. The cabin is a short drive to tons of beautiful areas of Colorado with great things to do. We ventured to Salida, did Monarch pass, Leadville, did Mosquito pass through an ATV tour group, did Independence pass to Aspen and finally Breckinridge. We left with our souls restored and will return again!

The view in the mornings, just memorizing. We loved being able to see various Colorado birds and mule deer on the property. As well as amazing wildlife nearby, and throughout Colorado! Stephanie was also very informative throughout our entire time and gave us very helpful tips to catch fish! Staying in this beautiful and fun little town of Fairplay was eye opening in the best of ways. We had an amazing time and cannot wait to be back!

review_text: Selfishly, I'd like to say this place is terrible just so I can have more availability for myself for the return trips again and again! Honestly, this is the most wonderful cabin I have ever booked. I have had this cabin bookmarked for two years, just trying to work out a time to get to it, and it was more than worth the wait. The place was perfect and had everything you could want. The mountain views are stunning. There aren't enough words to describe how much we enjoyed our stay here. If you're booking in the winter months, a 4-wheel drive is highly recommended. We needed it for the last couple of miles, but that just added to the fun! You'll feel like you are "off the grid" in this high-altitude paradise, but with all the comforts like great wifi, cell service and a super comfortable TV room with all the streaming services. Highly, highly recommend!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

Â·
December 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Cabin review:
So many extras were provided but not listed. Snow shoes w/ the walking sticks, sled, binoculars, eco friendly supplies (soaps/shampoo/ dish soap etc.), snow boots, rainfall walk-in shower, gourmet cookware, coffee thermos x2, travel tumblers, great spice rack and much more. We wanted nor needed anything else and could have packed a lot less. I'm unsure if airbnb limits descriptions or Stephanie assumes everyone else is as detail oriented as she is but for the first time in years, I felt someone took the wheel and let me finally relax for a bit.
Stephanie review:
When I first spoke to Stephanie regarding my wife's disabilities, Stephanie didn't give me the normal "sorry to hear that" response like others. Instead, she gathered new detailed pictures of areas I had concerns with so I had a clear understanding of the cabin (steps, flooring, handrails, rugs). My next vacation will be planned around Stephanie's availability. She is as much a gem as the cabin. We'll be back!

review_text: Our stay was perfect! Stephanie went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The location is fairly secluded, and has excellent views. There are a couple of minor drawbacks to the location, and Stephanie was quick to point them out and confirm that we were aware. The cabin is at close to 11,400 feet, so there is a real possibility of altitude sickness, especially in the mornings. In addition, there are some steeper inclines on gravel roads to get there, so it may be a more challenging drive without 4 wheel drive, depending on the weather, as gravel roads tend to stay icy longer. Overall, our stay was spectacular! Just a few small things to keep in mind when booking.

Pennsylvania Mountain was a nice hike up the road and we also ventured out to Limber Grove (beautiful ancient limber and bristlecone pines) and Mohawk Lakes (which was the busier of the three). All really beautiful and special in their own ways. Would highly recommend staying here!

name: Jeremy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Stephanie's cabin was absolutely perfect! We made a last minute decision to head further west after a couple of days in Boulder because we wanted to be somewhere a little more quiet and uncrowded. Stephanie replied quickly to the last minute booking request and the cabin was completely ready in a short time. The drive up to the cabin was fun, dirt roads up the mountain, but nothing too rough. The main road leading out there was regraded the day after we arrived and this made the first couple miles of dirt road very smooth. The location is perfect if you are seeking some solitude and quiet without being far from conveniences. Fairplay is about 15 minutes away if you need groceries, restaurants, gas, etc. This was a great base for several day trips as we were able to drive to several different mountains within 30-60 minutes and spend the day running and hiking. We were even able to drive to Mt. Elbert in less than 2 hours and spend the day hiking up to the top. Breckenridge is also not far away if that's your thing. We were also able to hike to the top of Pennsylvania Mountain right from the cabin without having to drive anywhere. That's a great option to have if you want to get one more mountain in for the day, but its a bit too late to drive somewhere.
The cabin itself has plenty of room to spread out in with a nice family room on the lower level as well as a bedroom and full bathroom. There is plenty of wood for the wood burning stove on the upper level and plenty of games located in the large chest near the stove. I wasn't traveling with kids, but there certainly would have been plenty for them to do at the cabin. There are even horseshoe pits outside. The best part for me was the large loft. At night, you can see tons of stars between the silhouettes if the tall pine trees. I did learn to close the curtains on the back windows as the sun can be quite bright in the morning. Make sure to do that if you are sleeping in the loft and want to sleep in.
I would definitely stay in Stephanie's cabin again. I wasn't sure how I would fare sleeping at that elevation since it was over 10K feet higher than where I live, but it didn't bother me much at all and I didn't notice anything after a couple of days. Just remember to slow down when needed if you are coming from a much lower altitude. :)
